isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - DIAGNOSTICS - SUSPECT DATA LINK CIRCUITS

svcproc.title: SUSPECT DATA LINK CIRCUITS
svcproc.para: If the power up test by the Speedometer/Tachometer module causes the speedometer and tachometer pointers to sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 1500 rpm while the speedometer sweeps between 0 and 38 mph:

step1.para: Use an EZ-Tech or Pro-Link 9000 EST to attempt to read engine rpm, oil pressure and water temperature at data link connector (137).

step2.para: If the EZ-Tech or Pro-Link 9000 reads information from the ECM, troubleshoot speedometer circuits between data link connectors (514) and (515) and Speedometer/Tachometer module connector (421). If those circuits check good, replace the Speedometer/Tachometer module.

If the EZ-Tech or Pro-Link 9000 cannot communicate with the ECM, insure that the vehicle Data Link is not shorted or wired incorrectly. With the ignition on, voltage from Positive data link circuit to ground should be approximately 4 volts. Voltage from Negative data link circuit to ground should be approximately 1 volt. Refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL, Electronic Engine Controls, in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual, and troubleshoot the data link circuits.
